meanings.definition: Shaped like a lance head, but with the base at the apex.
meanings.sent1: The leaf was oblanceolate, wider at the top than at the bottom.
meanings.sent2: The oblanceolate petals of the flower gave it a unique appearance.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the oblanceolate cake slice looked like a tiny sword.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of the oblanceolate tree branch stretched across the path.
meanings.sent5: The oblanceolate cloud in the sky resembled a pointed arrow.

meanings.definition: Having a rounded apex and tapering to a narrow base.
meanings.sent1: The fish had an oblanceolate body, rounded at the head and narrowing towards the tail.
meanings.sent2: The oblanceolate design of the vase made it stable on the table.
meanings.sent3: He found an oblanceolate rock that looked like a tiny mountain.
meanings.sent4: The oblanceolate shadow of the building stretched across the street.
meanings.sent5: The oblanceolate hill in the distance seemed to touch the sky.
